findings.title: Processing of initial balances
findings.description: Inconsistent processing of initial balances in Swapper.sol and SwapperV2.sol contracts.

findings.title: Check input amount equals swapped amount
findings.description: The bridge functions don’t check that input amount ( `_bridgeData.amount` or `msg.value` ) is equal to the swapped amount ( `_swapData[0].fromAmount` ). This could lead to funds remaining in the LiFi Diamond or Executor.

findings.title: Use same layout for facets
findings.description: The different bridge facets use different layouts for the source code.

findings.title: Safety check is missing on the remaining amount
findings.description: The bridge functions don’t check that input amount ( `_bridgeData.amount` or `msg.value` ) is equal to the swapped amount ( `_swapData[0].fromAmount` ). This could lead to funds remaining in the LiFi Diamond or Executor.

findings.title: Entire struct can be emitted
findings.description: The entire struct _lifiData can be emitted at once instead of specifying all fields individually, making the code smaller and easier to maintain.

findings.title: Redundant return value from internal function
Change comment on the LibAsset
findings.description: On the `LibAsset`, some of the functions are called through `LibAsset.` , however there is no need to call because the functions are in the same solidity file.

findings.title: Integrate all variants of _executeAndCheckSwaps()
findings.description: There are multiple functions that are more or less the same: swapAndCompleteBridgeTokensViaStargate() of Executor.sol, swapAndCompleteBridgeTokens() of Executor.sol, swapAndExecute() of Executor.sol, _executeAndCheckSwaps() of SwapperV2.sol, _executeAndCheckSwaps() of Swapper.sol, swapAndCompleteBridgeTokens() of XChainExecFacet

findings.title: Utilize NATIVE_ASSETID constant from LibAsset
findings.description: In the codebase, `LibAsset` library contains the variable which defines zero address. However, on the facets the check is repeated. Code should not be repeated and it’s better to have one version used everywhere to reduce likelihood of bugs.

findings.title: Native matic will be treated as ERC20 token
findings.description: _LiFi_ supports Polygon on their implementation. However, Native MATIC on the Polygon has the contract [0x0000000000000000000000000000000000001010](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x0000000000000000000000000000000000001010#code) address. Even if, It does not pose any risk, Native Matic will be treated as an ERC20 token.

findings.title: Multiple versions of noLeftovers modifier
findings.description: The modifier `noLeftovers` is defined in 3 different files: `Swapper.sol`, `SwapperV2.sol` and `Executor.sol`. While the versions on `Swapper.sol` and `Executor.sol` are the same, they differ with the one in `Executor.sol`. Assuming the recommendation for 'Processing of end balances' is followed, the only difference is that `noLeftovers` in `SwapperV2.sol` doesn’t revert when new balance is less than initial balance.

findings.title: Reduce unchecked scope
findings.description: Having `unchecked` for a large scope when it's applicable to only one line is dangerous.

findings.title: No event exists for core paths/functions
findings.description: Several key actions are defined without event declarations. Owner only functions that change critical parameters can emit events to record these changes on-chain for off-chain monitors/tools/interfaces.
